title: Contributing to Bedrock Layout

description1: Bedrock Layout is an open-source community project. We welcome contributions of all kinds, including bug reports, feature requests, and pull requests.
description2: There are many ways to contribute to the Bedrock Layout Primitives. Here are a few:

description3.tasks: Many of these tasks can be accomplished by
description3.tasksLink: filing an issue on the GitHub repository.
description3.tasks2: If you'd like to contribute code, please read the following guidelines below.

contributingCode.description1: Bedrock Layout Primitives is a monorepo of packages that are currently versioned independently of each other. It also utilizes Storybook as code playground, a documentation website, and visual regression test runner in chromatic.
contributingCode.description2.1: To manage all of these things, Bedrock uses
contributingCode.description2.2: to manage all the repositories into one monorepo. Lerna is used to publish to NPM, tag releases to Github, and process change logs under each package. To make the above possible in CI, Bedrock has adopted conventional commits and uses commitizen and husky to enforce it.
contributingCode.pullRequestsDescription: To make a pull request, do the following:
contributingCode.prOption2: Clone the repository from your GitHub.
contributingCode.prOption3: Set up your environment by running yarn.
contributingCode.prOption4: Check out a new branch and add your modification.
contributingCode.prOption5: Add test cases for all your changes.
contributingCode.prOption6: Update any README.md and documentation in Storybook under the examples folder in the corresponding package.
contributingCode.prOption7: Use commitizen to do git commit by running yarn cz (be sure to stage your changes first). Doing this will automatically run yarn verify as a pre-commit hook when you do this. If anything fails, fix and follow this step again.
contributingCode.prOption8: **DO NOT BUMP ANY VERSION NUMBERS OR UPDATE CHANGELOG.**
